DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Bone Marrow Specimen RT-PCR Outcome Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no, indeterminate indicator whether there was a result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of bone marrow, soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets, using reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR), a technique in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Bone Marrow Specimen RT-PCR Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of bone marrow, soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets, using reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR), a technique in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:RT-PCR is short for reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction. It is a technique in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification. Transcribing an RNA strand into a DNA complement is termed reverse transcription and is done by the enzyme reverse transcriptase. (from Wikipedia):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

A laboratory procedure in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification. Transcribing an RNA strand into a DNA complement is termed reverse transcription and is done by the enzyme reverse transcriptase.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
